title: For Sale/Trade:  Trijicon ACOG TA45 1.5x24 w/ ADM Quick Release Mount
postcontent:
For sale is a used TA45 1.5x24 amber dot Trijicon ACOG.  These sell for at least 800, and that is with the stock (moderately crappy) mount, not the one on this model.  It is used, and has minor cosmetic scuffs (see pics), but the glass is absolutely fine so if it is not going to be used on a safe queen it is more than good to go.  1.5 magnification, just enough to bring distant targets noticeably closer, while not sacrificing speed when used on close targets.  

This particular model has a TON of eye relief, I actually had it mounted to my *quad-rail*, and had no eye-relief issues.  It puts the eye relief of other ACOG's to shame, and has the most of the entire line of ACOG's that I am aware of.  Also I was a bit hesitant to use the amber reticle (I had always used red) but I was very pleased with it, and would not hesitate to buy more amber models in the future having used this one.

It is mounted in an American Defense quick release mount, which installs via a throw lever, and will return to zero after re-installed.  Pretty neat, and worth it, especially if you use other optics or practice with your irons.  

General information on the Trijicon ACOG:  If you've read this far, you probably know at least something about these.  They are illuminated via a fiber optic, which automatically adjusts to the ambient brightness (never too bright or dim for your environment), and are also illuminated via radioactive tritium which illuminates it in total darkness (the tritium has a half-life of around a decade, Trijicon offers replacement services).  They are commonly used by servicemembers for their ease of use, and extremely durable construction.  I have absolutely nothing against this optic, it has been exceptional in every way, I just personally prefer my aimpoint.
